Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Emission Characteristics Analysis and Health Risk Assessment of Unorganized VOCs in the Carbon Industry, Zhengzhou].

AbstractText: The three typical carbon enterprises in Zhengzhou were selected as research targets, and the emission characteristics of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and their ozone formation potential (OFP) in different functional areas were studied. The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) health risk assessment model was used to evaluate the health risks of VOCs emitted by the carbon industry. The results showed that the concentration of VOCs in the production areas of the three research enterprises was between 89.77-964.60 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>, and the management area was between 51.46-121.59 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>. Naphthalene and carbon disulfide were at the highest concentrations in the carbon plants. The ozone formation potential of VOCs in the production area was between 75.42-1416.73 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>, and in the management area was between 65.32-202.42 μg·m<sup>-3</sup>, mainly from the contribution of aromatic hydrocarbons and olefins. The carcinogenic health risk (Risk) of VOCs in the production area was 3.5×10<sup>-5</sup>-2.8×10<sup>-3</sup>, and in the management area was 2.0×10<sup>-5</sup>-9.4×10<sup>-5</sup>, which was higher than the maximum acceptable level recommended by the EPA (10<sup>-6</sup>). The non-carcinogenic health risk index (HI) of the VOCs in the production area was 3.2-1.4×10<sup>2</sup>, and in the management area was 4.3×10<sup>-1</sup>-3.8, except for the management area of the first enterprise, which was greater than 1, which may expose the workers. These health factors cause cancer and non-carcinogenic hazards.
